data.title: Famous Birthdays on October 24
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 24th of October. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on October 24.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 252

Domitian

Roman Emperor (81-96), born in Rome

David Stewart, Duke of Rothesay, heir to the throne of Scotland (d. 1402)

Isabella of Portugal, Queen consort of Spain, Queen of the Romans, and Lady of the Netherlands (1526-39), and Holy Roman Empress and Queen of Italy (1530-39), born in Lisbon, Portugal (d. 1539)

Giovanni Battista Caccini, Italian sculptor, born in Montopiaoli Val d'Arno, Duchy of Florence (now Italy) (d. 1613)

Anthony Babington, English page and conspirator to Mary, Queen of Scots convicted of plotting the assassination of Elizabeth I, born in Dethick, England (d. 1586)

John Lievens, Dutch painter, etcher and wood carver, born in Leiden, Dutch Republic (d. 1674)

Antonie van Leeuwenhoek

Dutch microbiologist, microscopist who was the first to observe bacteria and protozoa and naturalist (Philosophical Transactions), born in Delft, Dutch Republic

Richard Temple, 1st Viscount Cobham, English soldier and politician, born in Parchim, Mecklenburg-Schwerin, Germany (d. 1749)

Alban Butler, English Catholic priest and writer, born in Northampton, England (d. 1773)

Anna Amalia of Brunswick-Wolfenbüttel, German princess and composer (patron of Classical Weimar court), born in Wolfenbüttel (d. 1807)

Dorothea von Schlegel, German novelist (Florentin), born in Berlin, Germany (d. 1839)

Sarah Josepha Hale, American writer (Mary Had a Little Lamb), editor, activist, and founder of the Seaman's Aid Society of Boston, born in Newport, New Hampshire (d. 1879)

Jean Chrétien Baud, Dutch gov-gen of Dutch-Indies (1834-36), born in The Hague, Netherlands (d. 1859)

Friedrich Balduin von Gagern, German-Dutch army commandant, born in Weilburg, Germany (d. 1848)

Ferdinand Hiller, German pianist, composer and conductor, born in Frankfurt am Main, Germany (d. 1885)
